info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 4:12AM EDT until May 14 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
Rivanna River At Palmyra affecting Fluvanna County.
For the James River...including Palmyra...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rivanna River at Palmyra.
* WHEN...From early this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Farmland flooded downstream, including a section of Carysbrook Road.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:50 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:50 AM EDT Wednesday was 18.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.3 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.3 feet on 12/21/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 415 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
